abstract: The federal mortgage task force formed by the Justice Department has filed its first complaint against a big bank, contending that Bear Stearns, now a unit of JPMorgan Chase, and Bear’s lending unit, EMC Mortgage, defrauded investors who purchased mortgage securities packaged by the companies from 2005 through 2007.
lead_paragraph: The federal mortgage task force formed by the Justice Department has filed its first complaint against a big bank, contending that Bear Stearns, now a unit of JPMorgan Chase, and Bear’s lending unit, EMC Mortgage, defrauded investors who purchased mortgage securities packaged by the companies from 2005 through 2007. The civil suit contends that improper practices were institutionwide and affected numerous deals during the period, Gretchen Morgenson reports in The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: JPMorgan Unit Is Sued Over Mortgage Securities Pools
